title: Worked Solution
text: To find the slope of a line that passes through the points $$(-2,6)$$ and (1,4), we can use the slope formula: $$slope=\frac{y2-y1}{x2-x1}$$ Plugging in the coordinates of the two points, we get: $$slope=\frac{4-6}{1-\left(-2\right)}=\frac{-2}{3}=-0.66667$$ So the slope of the line that passes through the points $$(-2,6)$$ and (1,4) is -0.66667.
